title: Hall effect - compare potentials on plate

content.description: A current-carrying conducting plate is part of a larger circuit (not shown). The plate is in the plane of the figure, as shown. The conventional current <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll"> <mi>I</mi> </math> in the plate is directed to the right, as shown. The plate is in a region of magnetic field directed out of the plane of the figure.
content.question: Which of the following correctly compares the electric potential <math alttext="V sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>V</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math> at Point <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> on the plate to the electric potential <math alttext="V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> at Point <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> on the plate?

choices.label: <math alttext="V sub 1 is less than V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, V sub 1 equals V sub 2, close parenthesis equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, V sub 1 equals V sub 2, close parenthesis is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>
<math alttext="V sub 1 is greater than V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="V sub 1 is greater than V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
